body: Praying for Robert and the whole Henderson family. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to help with meals or rides!
We'll be lifting Robert up in prayer at our Bible study this week. Patricia, don't hesitate to call if you need anything at all.
Lord, we ask for Your healing hand over Robert. Grant the surgeons wisdom and give the family peace. Amen.
Heather and I can do a meal on Friday evening. Sarah, should we coordinate through you or reach out to Patricia directly?
That would be wonderful, Jason! I'll set up a meal train and share the link. Friday works perfectly.
This is so exciting! Caleb is finally old enough to attend this year. I'd love to help with the craft station too!
Lily can't wait! She's been asking about VBS since January. I can help with snack prep on Monday and Tuesday.
Count us in! Isabella will be there. I can volunteer for registration desk if that still needs to be filled.
Wonderful, Jessica! I'll put you down for crafts. And yes, Caleb is going to love it!
Grace, thank you for sharing this with us. We will be praying fervently for your mother. God is near to the brokenhearted.
Praying for complete healing and for peace that passes understanding for your whole family. You are so loved.
Lifting your mom up in prayer, Grace. Our God is the Great Physician. Please keep us updated.
Praying right now. If there's anything practical we can do to help, even from a distance, please let us know.
Romans 8:28 has been my anchor verse for years. Even when circumstances don't make sense, knowing that God is working all things together for good gives me such hope.
For me, verses 38-39 are the most powerful. Nothing in all creation can separate us from God's love. That's the foundation everything else rests on.
I've been meditating on verses 14-17 about adoption. As an adoptive parent myself, the imagery of being adopted into God's family hits differently. So beautiful.
Amen, Richard! That passage is one I come back to again and again. The list Paul gives is so comprehensive - nothing is left out.
Denise and I will be there! We're bringing her famous mac and cheese. See everyone Saturday!
We're looking forward to it! Is there a kids' area or should we bring something to keep the little ones busy?
Great question, Megan! We'll have a kids' corner set up with coloring sheets and games. Bring the kiddos!
Ana is making her arroz con pollo. It feeds an army! Can't wait to see everyone.
I can volunteer on Feb 22! I'll bring William too. Happy to help with loading boxes.
Steven and I will be there on March 1st. We also have several bags of canned goods to donate.
I'll sign up for both dates. This ministry is so important for our community.
Liam is so excited for this! I can be one of the adult chaperones. Just let me know what's needed.
Noah has been counting down the days! Angela and I can both help chaperone if you still need people.
Awesome, Sean! That gives us three chaperones. Just one more needed. Thanks so much!
Safe travels, Lisa and Richard! Praying for clear roads and a wonderful visit with your son.
Praying for safe travels! Enjoy the time with family.
What incredible news, Raj! God is so faithful. Congratulations to Priya! This is truly an answer to prayer.
Praise the Lord! We've been praying for this and I'm so happy for your family. God's timing is always perfect.
So happy for you all! God is good, all the time.
What a wonderful testimony of God's faithfulness! Celebrating with you!
I read this years ago and it profoundly shaped my understanding of God. I'd love to go through it again with a group!
Count me in! I've had it on my shelf but never gotten around to reading it. This would be great motivation.
Brian, this is a great idea. I'd suggest we do 2-3 chapters per week so it's manageable. Christine and I are both interested.
Love this! I've been looking for a way to connect with other moms. I'll be there on the 20th with Lily!
What a great idea, Amanda! I'll bring Ethan and join you. So looking forward to it!
Yes! Lucas and I will be there. Thanks for organizing this!
I'm in! I have a pressure washer I can bring. What time should we meet?
Count me in. I'll bring my hedge trimmer and mower.
Happy to help! I have some fencing supplies too if they're needed.
8 AM sharp, Matt! And yes, the pressure washer would be perfect. Thanks brother!
I'd love to hear 'In Christ Alone' more often. Such a powerful hymn.
How about 'It Is Well With My Soul'? It's been a while since we've sung that one and it's one of my favorites.
I really enjoy when we do 'Build My Life' by Housefires. Also, 'Great Is Thy Faithfulness' always moves me.
Great suggestion, Grace! We actually have that on the list for next month. Stay tuned!
Praying for Dave right now, Sean. What a privilege to be a light in his life during this dark season.
Lord, soften Dave's heart and draw him near. Give Sean the right words at the right time. Amen.
Praise God!! This is the best news! We've been praying for Mai and your whole family. What a faithful God we serve!
David, this is absolutely wonderful. God is so good. Thank you for sharing this praise report!
Maria and I will be there! We'll bring chips and dip. I call dibs on being the banker in Monopoly.
Sounds like a blast! Heather and I are in. We'll bring Ticket to Ride.
This is going to be a great resource for our church. Thanks for putting in the work on this, Matt!
I'd add 'Through the Word' to that list. It's a great app/podcast that walks through the Bible chapter by chapter. Very accessible.
